page.title: 12FARMING..MYRECAIRNIE
page.content: Myrecairnie is a mixed arable farm growing mainly wheat, barley, potatoes, oats and peas. The most prolific crop is barley which is sold, via a merchant, for Â£110 per ton. (this is a reduction from Â£120 per ton last year). Machinery is very important on the farm and accounts for the reduction in the number of farm workers employed. Chemicals too are a necessity, both for improving yield and dealing with weeds and pests. The farm requires no artificial drainage or irrigation although it would be possible to instal it if necessary. All the tractors, combine harvesters and farm vehicles have a C.B. radio fitted. A C.B. set in the house means that Mrs.Smith can contact her husband or the farm workers at anytime, thus saving valuable time.
